Description: A glazed pottery thin rim-sherd with a plain rim at the top and an external decorative design consisting of four or five loops of black paint with remains of blue infill on a light yellow background. A thin blue line runs parallel to the rim, while a larger one does on the internal side.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Probably from the North-west Ptolemaic mound
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.114, p.224, pl.66)
